name: Alexis Queenstown Motor Lodge and Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so sorry to only have one night in this beautiful motel. Our room was on the first floor and at the end with a splendid view over Lake Wakatipu and to the mountains beyond. The room was very well appointed and spotlessly clean. The owners were so very helpful and friendly, and kindly stored our luggage the following day as we had a day trip planned before driving on to Te Anau. We could not fault this lovely motel.
reviews.title: Superb motor lodge
Great view, great location in lovely Queenstown
reviews.text: We loved our stay here. We were here for two nights on our way down to Milford Sound. The motel is in the perfect position. Just a casual and pretty eight minute stroll into town, yet also far enough out of the centre of town to enjoy a bit of peace and quiet (Queenstown is very touristy). It is worth paying that little bit extra to get the room with the Panoramic view. Even though you are perched at the top of the hill and you do look out over roof tops it is still a very lovely and interesting view. By interesting I mean there is always something to look at. Out to the left you can see the Remarkables, out in front the lake and more mountains and then out to the right, the gondola going up to the skyline restaurant and the zip trek course. The room isn't flash but it has everything you need and it is clean. They could use a ceiling fan. Or even a portable fan. Even with the windows open it was still quite warm. But then again, I suppose it does not get that warm there that often. Staff were pleasant and recommended some good places to eat. We stayed in one other place on our way back through Queenstown just to try something different. In hindsight we wished we had just come back to this place. We will definitely come back again on our next trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stay one night on our way to the Southland area. We booked a big room and we just got a partial lake view from outside the living room (since we were not at the end of the property). Room was fine but no A/C in bedroom, so you may need in summer to open the window to get some fresh air. There is no breakfast included in their rate and as other reviewers mentioned the 30 minutes free internet is a kind of letdown and we will not stay here again. Nowadays, internet is a basic service and should be free 24 hrs. This is the kind of thing that makes sure I never come back to a Hotel when many others offer this as a free service.
reviews.title: Just fine for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Alexis Motel to find that we had the most wonderful views from our room. Out of one window we looked across the lake to the Remarkables and out of the other across another part of the lake and the peninsula to the mountains. It must be one of the most beautiful scenic views on earth. The room itself was large, spacious and very airy. A king size bed which was very comfortable, a well equipped kitchen and a very nice ensuite. The Motel is very handy for the town and you can easily walk into town. Although for us it was uphill back to Alexis and very difficult for us oldies. Parking is in an underground garage. Plenty of space for each car unless you get the idiot who thinks that you park astride the white line. Somebody left him a note on his windscreen. We never saw him again. A couple of problems, Because of the views from our room we kept getting Asian photographers outside our window taking pictures. You either draw your curtains and lose the view or watch your dress attire in the room. Breakfast was an extra cost, something not mentioned in their website or on their communications which are through the AA. WiFi is free but only for 30 mins per 24 hours something else not mentioned in their website or communications. Although when I pressed the point I was given another 100 MB but that can only be used for text. Any video used it up in 2 minutes flat.
reviews.title: A room with a stunning view

reviews.text: I would certainly recommend this hotel to others. Friendly owner, and it is within walking distance to town centre (15 mins), however the walk consists of a mixture of uphill and downhill. It has a gorgous view of the lake in sunset too!
reviews.title: Clean, value for money and within walking distance to town centre

reviews.text: The hosts, Adrienne and Kelly and lovely people, very helpful and friendly. The room is clean, comfortable and well equipped. Walking distance from town (about 10 mins). Lovely place would recommend it to anyone wanting a friendly, hospitable place to stay in Queenstown.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean, great for family holiday

reviews.text: The family unit we stayed was clean & comfortable. Host was very friendly & helpful. From the balcony we had a fantastic view of the lake and mountains. We were given 30 min complementary WiFi for each device to check our emails. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Cosy place with a great view

reviews.text: My 3 nights stay in Alexis Queenstown was nothing but amazing. Adrienne is a warm and wonderful host. The rooms are big and comfortable. If you're lucky enough to get the corner rooms, you get a breath taking view of Lake Wakatipu and the mountains.
reviews.title: Great hosts, great views, great stay

reviews.text: The Alexis is located on the main road entering into Queenstown (Frankton Rd). It has a covered parking garage. The rooms are extremely clean and has a decent TV and DVD player. A vast selection of DVDs are also free and avalible at the front desk.
reviews.title: Big Apartments, Good views, hard parking

reviews.text: It is a good 10 mins walk to Queenstown area and the hosts would gladly help you book any tours you are interested in.
reviews.title: Weekend get away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This accomodation is in a great location just a short walk to the town centre and the lake. The rooms are clean,spacious and well equipped with views of the lake. The owners were very helpful with booking our jet boating trip with Dart River Safari (a 'must do') and horseriding on a local farm.
reviews.title: Great Location
What a great place and what great people!
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four wonderful days in Queenstown over the New Year’s holiday and stayed at the Alexis Motor Hotel. We selected this place based on outstanding reviews and it’s easy to see why everyone likes it. It’s located about a ten minute walk from the heart of Queenstown but enough outside the hustle and bustle that it’s very quiet at night (and this even included New Year’s Eve - but we were close enough to be able to watch the fireworks from a balcony and sheltered from the rain). We asked the proprietor for a recommendation on good seafood and he gave us two choices. One was a fairly expensive but highly rated restaurant. The other was a seafood shack on the Marine Parade that was cheap but really good. He didn’t even know the name (it’s Aggy’s) but knew it was a great deal. He was right! The rooms are spacious, clean, and ours included a spa tub. The view from our front window was of the Incredibles and the Frankton Arm of Lake Wakatipu. From the kitchen window (kitchen has cook top, refrigerator, sink, and microwave) we could see the gondola up to Skyline. Not bad for a budget location. There is a charge for local calls and we had to make five to confirm or change tour reservations. We went to the office to settle the bill and they said it’s only $2 so forget it! What a great place and what great people! Note that they provide 30 min. of free internet per device per 24 hrs. This means that your best strategy is to log on early and at the same time each day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent six days in a panoramic studio room and found the room very large, kitchenette great and view fabulous. The owners were extremely hospitable and made us feel very welcome. Was able to glance in quite a few rooms and they all looked equally as comfortable and well appointed. The bed was a bit hard for our liking, but that's just our preference. Would thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: we're 9 persons from China and book 2 room, the boss and boss's wife are so friendly,they gave us so many helps. the room is so big ,the ketchen is so good,we did so much cooking. and there is a big parking area ,the view nearby is so beautiful. i love walking by the lake down the road of this motel in the morning. so so so beautiful.
reviews.title: absolutely 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked a "lakeview studio apartment" with spa in the Alexis, but somehow our paid and confirmed booking, made through a large international booking company during the week or so before our planned stay, was stuffed up. The owners (managers?) refused to take responsibility even though it was obviously their fault, and didn't try to contact us before we arrived to tell us they had oversold our room, leaving us with the task of finding last minute accommodation at about 6 O'Clock at night.
reviews.title: Awful customer service and inconsistent room quality

reviews.text: Excellent place to stay. The room was large and clean with stunning views over the lake and mountains. Although the hotel is on the main road it is still quiet at night. The hosts were very friendly and helpful. Less than 10 minutes walk into centre of Queenstown.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay in Queenstown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here in Queenstown. The room was large and the view was stunning! There was a massive spa bath in the bathroom. Friendly and helpful staff. The walk into town was about 10 mins down a steep hill but there's no escaping the hills in Queenstown! Excellent town :)
reviews.title: Super - stunning view!
Lesley
reviews.text: We stayed at the Alexis and at the Hilton while we were in Queenstown and we would always choose to stay at the Alexis again. We had a really warm welcome. The rooms were lovely - good facilities and very clean - and the views over Lake Wakatipu were wonderful. The walk into town is lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't like pre booking accommodation unless it's by recommendation.
reviews.title: Very clean and well kept and good views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this one because of the looks outside and the inside didn't let us down. They take you to view the room before you pay and the cleanliness was excellent.
reviews.title: Teriffic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Alexis is a gem. The rooms were large, comfortable and meticulously clean. It's just outside of Queenstown (therefore quieter), with three gorgeous options for the 10-minute stroll into town. Hostess Faye (subbing for the owners who were on holiday) was wonderfully kind and helpful with suggestions of restaurant and expeditions. This hotel has the best views of Lake Wakatipu and the Remarkables of anywhere in town!
reviews.title: Incredible Views/Large, Clean Rooms

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this complex. We had a beautiful Lake View as well as Mountain views.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

aka: Alexis Queenstown Motor Lodge And Apartments Hotel Queenstown
description: Alexis Motor Lodge & Apartments is the perfect place to stay in Queenstown and enjoy the excellent views and the best the region has to offer - from a relaxing glass of wine out on the terrace to a short 10min stroll into the centre of Queenstown. We have 16 luxury units including studios and 1 & 2-bedroom units. Some studio units have spa baths and we have free underground parking.
